title: Protein Atlas - Exploration and Baseline
description: Welcome to the Human Protein Atlas Competition!I started this kernel notebook to explore the data and build a simple baseline model to play with. I have never mind that the results are useful for many kagglers that like to start with the competition but need some starter code or some inspiration. Thank you for pushing this kernel that far! :-) If you have just found this kernel, here is a short summary of what you can find:  Encoding of binary target labels out of the given multilabel list per image, Visual analysis of target protein distribution in the train set, A simple image generator that yields images of a target-protein-wishlist. Each sample that has at least one match with this list is returned. Some ideas on validation. A baseline model build with keras that is supported by: A modelparameter class that holds all parameters that are necessary to build the model, to load the data and to preprocess the images. A data generator that can be used with CPU/GPU computing to perform training and validation. An image preprocessor that rescales, reshapes and normalizes the images for feeding into the model.   Ideas on how to improve the baseline model by tracking loss with a keras callback.  Some ideas on how to proceed. (coming soon)
sum_nltk:
Welcome to the Human Protein Atlas Competition!I started this kernel notebook to explore the data and build a simple baseline model to play with.
I have never mind that the results are useful for many kagglers that like to start with the competition but need some starter code or some inspiration.
:-) If you have just found this kernel, here is a short summary of what you can find:  Encoding of binary target labels out of the given multilabel list per image, Visual analysis of target protein distribution in the train set, A simple image generator that yields images of a target-protein-wishlist.
Each sample that has at least one match with this list is returned.
Some ideas on validation.
A baseline model build with keras that is supported by: A modelparameter class that holds all parameters that are necessary to build the model, to load the data and to preprocess the images.
A data generator that can be used with CPU/GPU computing to perform training and validation.
An image preprocessor that rescales, reshapes and normalizes the images for feeding into the model.
Ideas on how to improve the baseline model by tracking loss with a keras callback.
Some ideas on how to proceed.
